Anglesey – Consultation: opening hours, closures, co-locations and other options included.
Gateshead – Chopwell Library to be moved into primary school to cut costs by £19k per year. Start-up cost is £129k.
Isle of Wight – £140 cut 2015/16 leading to ongoing £280k cut from 2016/17. Cowes, Freshwater and Ventnor libraries to be run with town council support and/or have hours cut.

Brighton and Hove – Hove Library may close and move into Hove Museum. Westdene Library may close and move into Westdene Primary School. Hollingbury Library may close and move into Hollingbury Children’s Centre.
St Helens – Housebound service takes on volunteers to expand service previously provided by one paid member of staff.
Hounslow – Consultation on future of libraries.
Lincolnshire – Washingborough Library; Coningsby/Tattershall, Skellingthorpe; Wragby.closed. Holbeach to be volunteer run shortly.
Buckinghamshire – Volunteer library to be run from Waddesdon Secondary School.
Norfolk – 27 out of 47 libraries may close by 2018/19: £1.59m cut.
Leicestershire – Barwell Library will close as volunteer plan falls through.
Anglesey – Holyhead Library may move into Market Hall.

Birmingham – £2m conversion of Library of Birmingham, with first floor conference rooms and study areas being taken over by a language school (part of Birmingham Adult Education Services). Opening hours will be at least partly restored.

Oxfordshire – £1m cut inc. loss of 4 mobiles and 2 children’s service vehicles, cut in bookfund, retendering of library management system. Customer services staff to work in libraries making them the "new front door" for the council. Reduction in library staff.
Cornwall – £1.8m cut to service, with preferred option being to transfer libraries to other town or parish councils/volunteers.
Shropshire – Albrighton Library to be taken over by parish council, with council offices moving into library.
Dudley – Employee-led mutual to run libraries/archives/adult learning from April 2016. Savings expected to allow for 11% budget cut 2016/17 to 30% 2017/18.
Kirklees – Kirkburton Library given to parish council. and then loaned back to council at nil rent for five years with one paid staff and the rest being volunteers.
Northern Ireland – 144 voluntary redundancies since 2009, 19 more expected 2015/16. Bookfund reduced from £3.4 million four years ago to £2.7 million this year.
Newham – Opening hours extended until 8pm all days except Sunday in 5 libraries. 5% increase in usage 2014/15.
Poole – Volunteer library (additional to service) opens at Upton Country Park. Mobile library will be permanently sited at Talbot Primary School.
Walsall – Confirmed £328k cut this year plus additional £159k next. 7 out of 16 libraries to close, plus mobile to close. 13 jobs lost.
Cambridgeshire – £535k cut over two years: loss of mobile library service, more volunteers, reductions in opening hours.
Dorset – Book buying frozen until April.
Norfolk – Cuts to library service abandoned.
Worcestershire – Bromsgrove Library will close on 14th November and re-open in co-located "Parkside Hub" end of month.
Hillingdon – Council buys back lease on Yiewsley Library.
Milton Keynes – Bletchley Library receives £529k for refurbishment: will collocate with others, possibly police.
Worcestershire – Bromsgrove Library will close on 14th November and re-open in co-located "Parkside Hub" end of month
